update.description:
We had a bad connection between QT and OGRE. Basically too many timers.

The primary changes:

1. Remove QTimer from `gui/RenderWidget`
1. Properly set the time the last frame was rendered in `rendering/Camera.cc`

Prior to this change the UserCamera would render somewhere between 20 and 30Hz. It will now reach over 60, and over a few hundred Hz if you adjust the update rate in UserCamera (also depends on your graphics card, and the type of world).

You'll most likely notice that the GUI feels more snappy.

A soon-to-follow pull request to default will add a test. Have to put the test in default because it breaks ABI.

**Update**: Test added.

**Update**: This is the backport of pull request #1488
update.title: Fix QT rendering, and rendering update rate

content.raw:
MainWindow_TEST segfaults on this branch, though apparently at a different point than the other branch:

```
********* Start testing of MainWindow_TEST *********
Config: Using QTest library 4.8.6, Qt 4.8.6
PASS   : MainWindow_TEST::initTestCase()
QWARN  : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() QObject::connect: Cannot connect (null)::DeleteSignal(const std::string &) to gazebo::gui::ModelCreator::OnDelete(const std::string &)

FPS[57.2185]

QFATAL : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() Received signal 11
FAIL!  : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() Received a fatal error.
   Loc: [Unknown file(0)]
Totals: 1 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of MainWindow_TEST *********
Aborted (core dumped)
```
content.html:
MainWindow_TEST segfaults on this branch, though apparently at a different point than the other branch:

********* Start testing of MainWindow_TEST *********

QWARN  : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() QObject::connect: Cannot connect (null)::DeleteSignal(const std::string &) to gazebo::gui::ModelCreator::OnDelete(const std::string &)

FPS[57.2185]

QFATAL : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() Received signal 11
FAIL!  : MainWindow_TEST::UserCameraFPS() Received a fatal error.
   Loc: [Unknown file(0)]
Totals: 1 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of MainWindow_TEST *********
Aborted (core dumped)

update.description:
We had a bad connection between QT and OGRE. Basically too many timers.

The primary changes:

1. Remove QTimer from `gui/RenderWidget`
1. Properly set the time the last frame was rendered in `rendering/Camera.cc`

Prior to this change the UserCamera would render somewhere between 20 and 30Hz. It will now reach over 60, and over a few hundred Hz if you adjust the update rate in UserCamera (also depends on your graphics card, and the type of world).

You'll most likely notice that the GUI feels more snappy.

A soon-to-follow pull request to default will add a test. Have to put the test in default because it breaks ABI.

**Update**: Test added.
